required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Gonadotrophin Releasing Hormone Agonist Addition for Luteal Support in In-vitro Fertilization and Embryo Transfer Cycles
clinical_study.official_title: Gonadotrophin Releasing Hormone Agonist Addition for Luteal Support in In-vitro Fertilization and Embryo Transfer Cycles

lead_sponsor.agency: Northwest Women's and Children's Hospital, Xi'an, Shaanxi

clinical_study.source: Northwest Women's and Children's Hospital, Xi'an, Shaanxi

brief_summary.textblock: The study was designed to investigate the effect of luteal-phase administration of gonadotrophin releasing hormone agonist(GnRHa) on pregnancy outcomes in in-vitro fertilization-embryo transfer.

arm_group.description: Intervention: additional GnRHa for routine LPS GnRHa group receive three injections of GnRHa(Decapeptyl) ,0.1 mg s.c. on the day of ET, and D3 and D6 after ET in addition to routine LPS.
Control group receive only the routine LPS.

intervention.description: GnRHa group receive three injections of GnRHa(Decapeptyl) ,0.1 mg s.c. on the day of ET, and D3 and D6 after ET in addition to routine LPS.
